paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the TTR gene variant V122I in the context of systemic AL amyloidosis, focusing on its prevalence among different racial/ethnic groups and its implications for disease presentation.

functional_data.summary: The V122I variant is associated with hereditary ATTR amyloidosis, particularly prevalent in individuals of African ancestry.

variants.segregation_data: The variant is screened in self-reported Black patients due to its high prevalence in this population.
variants.population_frequency: The variant is notably prevalent among individuals of African ancestry.
variants.evidence_level: Moderate evidence based on population studies and functional assays.
variants.additional_notes: The presence of the V122I allele was confirmed through mass spectrometric analysis of tissue.
key_quotes: In view of the high prevalence of hereditary ATTR amyloidosis among individuals of African ancestry, self-reported Black patients underwent screening for the transthyretin V122I genetic variant.

extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction was straightforward as the paper specifically focused on the TTR gene variant V122I.
